summary.conference_name: The 33rd IEEE International Conference on Software Analysis, Evolution and Reengineering (SANER 2026)
summary.location: 5* St. Raphael Resort and Marina, Limassol, Cyprus
summary.description: The 33rd edition of the IEEE International Conference on Software Analysis, Evolution, and Reengineering (SANER 2026) invites high-quality submissions of papers describing original and unpublished research results.

types: Reproducibility Studies and Negative Results (RENE) Track

topics: AI for Software Engineering and Software Engineering for AI
Generative AI and LLM applied to analysis, evolution and reengineering of software
Software Analysis, Parsing, and Fact Extraction
Software Maintenance and Evolution, Evolution Analysis
Software Architecture Recovery and Reverse Architecting
Mining Software Repositories and Software Analytics
Software Release Engineering, Continuous Integration and Delivery
Software Tools for Software Evolution and Maintenance
Human factors and legal aspects in the context of Software Analysis, Evolution and Reengineering
Empirical studies on all the above topics
Education related to all of the above topics

english.page_limit: 12 pages for Research and Industrial Papers, 6 pages for Short Papers and Posters, 5 pages for Tool Demos
english.format: PDF format conforming to IEEE Conference Proceedings Formatting Guidelines

summary.review_process: rigorous peer review process based on originality, quality, soundness, and relevance
